API

cricguru.player

class cricguru.player.Player(player_id)[source]

Bases: object

The Player class contains all the functions that extract data related to players

batsman_summary(query_params)[source]

Returns the summary stats of all batters dismissed.

Parameters

query_params (dict[str, list, or set or dict]) – A dictionary containing all the query parameters.

Returns

A dataframe containing the query results

Return type

pandas.Dataframe

Raises

Exception – Functions that return bowling data will not work with batting parameters

bowler_summary(query_params)[source]

Returns the summary of stats against all bowlers faced.

Parameters

query_params (dict[str, list, or set or dict]) – A dictionary containing all the query parameters.

Returns

A dataframe containing the query results

Return type

pandas.Dataframe

Raises

Exception – Functions that return batting data will not work with bowling parameters

career_summary(query_params)[source]

Returns the career summary stats of the player.

Parameters

query_params (dict[str, list, or set or dict]) – A dictionary containing all the query parameters.

Returns

cric_data – A dataframe containing the query results

Return type

pandas.Dataframe

Examples

player = player.Player(49764)
query_params = {
    'class' : '1',
    'type' : 'allround'
}

cric_data = player.career_summary(query_params)
print(cric_data.head())

class cricguru.team.Team[source]

Bases: object

The Team class contains all the functions that extract overall and teams related data.

by_host(query_params, limit=100)[source]

Returns the overall stats for each team by host team.

Parameters

  • query_params (dict[str, list, or set or dict]) – A dictionary containing all the query parameters.

  • limit (int) – The data limit for number of records returned. Default limit is 100.

Returns

A dataframe containing the query results

Return type

pandas.Dataframe

Module contents

Cricguru

This package contains functions for retrieving data from the Statsguru data query on ESPN Cricinfo. The main classes cover teams and players data. The results are returned as a Pandas dataframe in order to facilitate data analysis on cricket data.
